Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Sehetepib; winged sun-disc at the top; central panel containing an offering-list flanked on either side by two tiers of offering-bearers; below are twelve columns of Hieroglyphic text and a scene of two seated couples on either side of a pile of offerings and two tables.
Bibliographic references: Scott-Moncrieff 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 2. (pl.26-27)
